verses.text_plain: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,
verses.verse_html: 1Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,

verses.text_plain: How long wilt thou speak these things? and how long shall the words of thy mouth be like a strong wind?
verses.verse_html: 2How long wilt thou speak these things? and how long shall the words of thy mouth be like a strong wind?

verses.text_plain: Doth God pervert judgment? or doth the Almighty pervert justice?
verses.verse_html: 3Doth God pervert judgment? or doth the Almighty pervert justice?

verses.text_plain: If thy children have sinned against him, and he have cast them away for their transgression;
verses.verse_html:
4If thy children have sinned against him, and he have cast them away for their transgression; ▼
▼ for…: Heb. in the hand of their transgression

tokens.text: against him, and he have cast them away

footnotes.body_text: ▼ for…: Heb. in the hand of their transgression
footnotes.body_html: ▼ for…: Heb. in the hand of their transgression

verses.text_plain: If thou wouldest seek unto God betimes, and make thy supplication to the Almighty;
verses.verse_html: 5If thou wouldest seek unto God betimes, and make thy supplication to the Almighty;

verses.text_plain: If thou wert pure and upright; surely now he would awake for thee, and make the habitation of thy righteousness prosperous.
verses.verse_html: 6If thou wert pure and upright; surely now he would awake for thee, and make the habitation of thy righteousness prosperous.

tokens.text: for thee, and make the habitation

verses.text_plain: Though thy beginning was small, yet thy latter end should greatly increase.
verses.verse_html: 7Though thy beginning was small, yet thy latter end should greatly increase.

verses.text_plain: For enquire, I pray thee, of the former age, and prepare thyself to the search of their fathers:
verses.verse_html: 8For enquire, I pray thee, of the former age, and prepare thyself to the search of their fathers:

tokens.text: I pray thee, of the former

verses.text_plain: (For we are but of yesterday, and know nothing, because our days upon earth are a shadow:)
verses.verse_html:
9(For we are but of yesterday, and know nothing, because our days upon earth are a shadow:) ▼
▼ nothing: Heb. not

verses.text_plain: Shall not they teach thee, and tell thee, and utter words out of their heart?
verses.verse_html: 10Shall not they teach thee, and tell thee, and utter words out of their heart?

verses.text_plain: Can the rush grow up without mire? can the flag grow without water?
verses.verse_html: 11Can the rush grow up without mire? can the flag grow without water?

verses.text_plain: Whilst it is yet in his greenness, and not cut down, it withereth before any other herb.
verses.verse_html: 12Whilst it is yet in his greenness, and not cut down, it withereth before any other herb.

verses.text_plain: So are the paths of all that forget God; and the hypocrite’s hope shall perish:
verses.verse_html: 13So are the paths of all that forget God; and the hypocrite’s hope shall perish:

verses.text_plain: Whose hope shall be cut off, and whose trust shall be a spider’s web.
verses.verse_html:
14Whose hope shall be cut off, and whose trust shall be a spider’s web. ▼
▼ web: Heb. house

verses.text_plain: He shall lean upon his house, but it shall not stand: he shall hold it fast, but it shall not endure.
verses.verse_html: 15He shall lean upon his house, but it shall not stand: he shall hold it fast, but it shall not endure.

tokens.text: it fast, but it shall not endure

verses.text_plain: He is green before the sun, and his branch shooteth forth in his garden.
verses.verse_html: 16He is green before the sun, and his branch shooteth forth in his garden.

verses.text_plain: His roots are wrapped about the heap, and seeth the place of stones.
verses.verse_html: 17His roots are wrapped about the heap, and seeth the place of stones.

verses.text_plain: If he destroy him from his place, then it shall deny him, saying, I have not seen thee.
verses.verse_html: 18If he destroy him from his place, then it shall deny him, saying, I have not seen thee.

verses.text_plain: Behold, this is the joy of his way, and out of the earth shall others grow.
verses.verse_html: 19Behold, this is the joy of his way, and out of the earth shall others grow.

verses.text_plain: Behold, God will not cast away a perfect man, neither will he help the evil doers:
verses.verse_html:
20Behold, God will not cast away a perfect man, neither will he help the evil doers: ▼
▼ help…: Heb. take the ungodly by the hand
 , ▼
▼ come: Heb. shall not be

footnotes.body_text: ▼ help…: Heb. take the ungodly by the hand
footnotes.body_html: ▼ help…: Heb. take the ungodly by the hand
▼ come: Heb. shall not be

verses.text_plain: Till he fill thy mouth with laughing, and thy lips with rejoicing.
verses.verse_html:
21Till he fill thy mouth with laughing, and thy lips with rejoicing. ▼
▼ rejoicing: Heb. shouting for joy

footnotes.body_html: ▼ rejoicing: Heb. shouting for joy

verses.text_plain: They that hate thee shall be clothed with shame; and the dwelling place of the wicked shall come to nought.
verses.verse_html:
22They that hate thee shall be clothed with shame; and the dwelling place of the wicked shall come to nought. ▼
▼ shall come…: Heb. shall not be

footnotes.body_text: ▼ shall come…: Heb. shall not be
footnotes.body_html: ▼ shall come…: Heb. shall not be
